textBox.richText: Each January, MIT shuts down and instead holds IAP (aka Independent Activities Period), where students can take classes, both for credit and for fun. During my first IAP, I took a class called Intro to Processing. Processing is basically a language that makes it easier to graphically program in Java. For my final project, I created a game called Balloon Shooters, where you accumulate points, by well, shooting balloons, where each balloon has a different point value. Consider this my first foray into graphics. Our instructor still has our projects on her website: http://mishmadsen.com/6.914/jpchan/applet/ However, be warned that because it’s java running in your browser (and the game is in java- not the optimal graphics language), it runs super slow.
